data.title: Asian Paints Doubles Returns On Exit From Akzo Nobel
data.description: Asian Paints had acquired a stake in Akzo Nobel in fiscal year 2017-18, when the fair value of the holding was around Rs 359.81 crore. The company has now sold its entire stake through an open market transaction, offloading over 20 lakh shares at approximately Rs 3,651 per share on the NSE. The deal is valued at about Rs 730 crore.
data.keywords: Akzo Nobel India Ltd., Asian Paints Ltd.
data.snippet: India’s largest paint maker, Asian Paints, is navigating an intensely competitive phase, but that hasn’t stopped the company from doubling the returns on it...

data.title: Akzo Nobel shares in focus after Asian Paints offloads entire stake for Rs 734 crore via bulk deal
data.description: Asian Paints divested its entire 4.42% stake in Akzo Nobel India for ₹734 crore, selling shares at ₹3,651 apiece. This follows JSW Paints' planned acquisition of a 74.76% controlling stake from Akzo Nobel's Dutch promoters for ₹8,986 crore. The Dutch parent group exits the Indian paints market amid new competition, pending regulatory approvals.
data.keywords: asian paints, akzo nobel india, akzo nobel, akzo nobel share price, akzo nobel stocks, akzo nobel shares, Asian Paints stake sale, JSW Paints acquisition, Indian paints market, bulk deal, stock exchange filing, Competition Commission of India
